Description: Bag-type sprang hair-net mainly in blue wool with stripes in red and green; each stripe is accompanied by two extra threads of undyed linen or wool which repeatedly cross and divide, creating a pattern of circles; a plaited braid or ribbon of red wool was sewn along one side of the opening, c. 7mm wide; at the opposite side are loops of warp thread with a red cord threaded twice through them, with the ends of the cord being knotted to the ends of the braid; at the bottom of the bag, a finer red cord has been threaded once through the warp threads, just to the underside of a row of chaining; warp-wool and linen (S spun Z ply/c.10); two simple selvedges, loops c.1.2 cm long on one end, short loops sewn into the plait at the other end; plait sewn on and side seams in blue and red wool (S spun Z ply), cords are S spun, some Z ply, 2 S twist; shallowness suggests only covered the back of the head
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
